diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Familial Gestational Spontaneous Ovarian Hyperstimulation Syndrome
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The proband had multiple pregnancies complicated by ovarian hyperstimulation syndrome (OHSS), characterized by abdominal pain, nausea, and ultrasonographic findings of enlarged, multilocular ovaries with ascites. Genetic testing identified a mutation in the follicle-stimulating hormone receptor leading to hypersensitivity to chorionic gonadotropin, which was linked to the recurrent episodes of OHSS.
